dataset.title: Total numbers and species of insects taken from the Kuparuk River rock scrubbings during the summer of 1989, Arctic LTER 1989.

abstract.para: Total numbers and species of insects taken from the Kuparuk River rock scrubbings during the summer of 1989.

intellectualRights.para: Acceptance and utilization of LTER data requires that:

listitem.para: The Principal Investigator be sent a notice stating reasons for acquiring any data and a description of the publication intentions.
The Principal Investigator of the data set be sent a copy of the report or manuscript prior to submission and be adequately cited in any resultant publications

A copy of any resultant publications should be sent to:
Principal Investigator Ecosystems Center Marine Biological Laboratory Woods Hole, MA 02543

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: The Kuparuk River in arctic Alaska, approximately 3 km south and 1 km north of the river crossing at the Dalton Highway (68 38'15"N, 149 25'30"W).

description.para:
Log of changes:
6March90. Changed name of file from KUP89TOT to 89HEKTOT. Changed the d/d distances to all be kilometers instead of meters and kilometers. 8Mar90. Experimental Methods: changed the single date sampling dat to 14 July 1989 (for 88) File changed to new file received July 91.

For Archival Use:
DATE RECEIVED: 27Feb90, Jul91 DATA FILE ENTERED BY: Julie Pallant DATA FILE VALIDATION: NAME: Julie Pallant DATE: 7Mar90, 3Oct91

para.literalLayout: A rock-scrubbing technique was used to collect bottom samples at eight different stations (-500m, -400m, -100m, 320m, 740m, 1k, 2k, and 3k) with three replicates at each station in the Kuparuk River. The stations are measured relative to the 1984 phosphorus dripper. One sampling date is represented here (14 July 1989). (This is the first date analyzed, others are top priority at time of this submission.) The samples were preserved in ethanol then picked, sorted, counted, and measured in Duluth using a NIKON MICRO-PLAN II digitizing pad.

Notes: Only six of the eight stations at this date were analyzed because of time constraints. The two recovery stations (320m and 740m) will be done soon (along with all other samples for the Kuparuk and the Oksrukuyuk rivers).

Variable Variable descrip. Precis./Units Coded Missing (Y/N) Values SITE Kuparuk River y DATE date DD-MMM-YY n STATION distance from 1984 dripper km n SECTOR SAMPLE repetition number A1,A2,1,2, or 3 n BRACHY number of Brachycentrus n ORTHO number of Orthocladius n BLACK number of Black Flies n BAETIS number of Baetis n CHIRON number of Chironomids n RYACEPH number of Ryacephila n CHIPUPA number of Chironomid pupae n BLKPUPA number of Black Fly pupae n BAETSP3 number of Baetis "species 3" n CINYG number of Cinygmula n COMMENT comments n
